title: ISic000175. Epitaph for Aulus Fabricius
body:
Facsimile Images

LCASS[---]
A(ulus) ((·)) Fabricius ((·)) A(uli) ((·)) f(ilius)
Primus
Postumia
5Fausta
Fabricia

Apparatus criticus

Text from autopsy; Mommsen: LCAS[---]; Bivona: [---]a[---]; the traces are compatible with L·CASS[ius], and assuming the compression implied by the 'SS', a complete personal name with short cognoment on line 1; initial P might also be possible.

English translation

Lucius Cassius(?) [---], Aulus Fabricius Primus, son of Aulus, Postumia Fausta, Fabricia

commentary

Bivona makes no reference to the traces in line 1 in discussion; she suggests that the female names in lines 4-6 resolve as two individuals, Postumia Fausta and Fabricia, but clearly other permutations are possible. The traces in line 1 seem most compatible with another male personal name in the nominative, rather than any sort of heading.

bibliography

  • Castelli 1784 331 no.2 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10002083
  • 10.7404 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10000589
  • 97 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10002137
Licensed under a Creative Commons-Attribution 4.0 licence.
